page.title: 08CRANFIELD INSTITUTE OF TECH.
page.content: Present activities at the {Institute can be traced back to 1943 when the Aeronautical Research Council was asked by the Minister of Aircraft Production to study the possibility of founding a school of aeronautical science. Subsequently Cranfield,partly because of the presence of the airfield was chosen and the{College of {Aeronautics}( the first of the Institute's departments ) was born. Prior to the Institute the airfield had opened as a bomber base for the R.A.F on 1 June 1937. Today there are over 5,500 students attending the many courses run by a staff of 1400. The newest department at the Institute - which has acquired university status - is the School of Management, now one of the largest and most respected business schools in Europe.
